meanings.definition: To make someone feel nervous or confused.
meanings.sent1: The unexpected question flustering the student during the exam.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise outside was flustering her concentration.
meanings.sent3: Trying to juggle too many tasks at once can be quite flustering.
meanings.sent4: The maze of hallways in the old building was flustering to navigate.
meanings.sent5: The sudden change in plans left her feeling flusteringly disoriented.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to become agitated or flustered.
meanings.sent1: His constant interruptions were flustering her attempts to focus.
meanings.sent2: The crowded room and loud chatter were flustering him.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept flustering the calm cat.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected news was like a storm, flustering everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The urgent deadline was flustering, causing a rush of anxiety.
